Topic.Title: NEARLY HALF OF ALL AMERICANS SAY SURVEILLANCE ARE ACCEPTABLE WITHIN LIMITS

Message.Msg: Yes - but that's YOUR CHOICE You can choose to use Google products or not. You can't choose if NSA will listen to your call or not. It is generally known that phone's microphone can be turned on remotely without your permission IF police has a court approved permit to wiretap. What NSA is doing is bypassing all "checks and balances" of the court system in the name of national security. If you TRUST that there is not a single government employee that will abuse this ability, then you should not be concerned about any of this at all.... Otherwise - your only choices are to either pull the battery out of your phone when not in use, or fight the 'patriot act's' legitimacy...

Message.Title: Phone monitoring factoids
Message.Msg: BO ended the Bush practice of WARRANTLESS wiretaps. "And here are the key details that seem to have been lost in the commotion: The programs are not secret; every member of congress has been fully aware of the phone call program The programs only collect telephone metadata (phone numbers and duration of calls)–not actual voice recordings (phone co. routinely kept these records anyway for billing and marketing) If they actually want to listen to a phone call as the result of a lead, they then have to go to a federal judge–just like usual The program is continually overseen by congress and by the FISA court, i.e. the legislative and judicial branches of oversight For the Internet monitoring, it doesn’t even apply to U.S. citizens or to people living in the United States So, assuming this is true, I’m having trouble seeing the cause for outrage."

Message.Title: Racism is learned from racist parents
Message.Msg: "These are the things we have learned to day about how members of Senator Jeff Flake's family talk and feel about minorities. Gay people are "fa**ots, Mexicans are the #$%$ of the Earth and Black people should be killed. Welcome to Arizona. Arizona Senator’s Son Used Homophobic, Anti-Semitic Language On Twitter Sen. Jeff Flake’s high school–aged son Tanner used Twitter to threaten the #$%$” who stole his bike that he “will find you, and … will beat the #$%$ out of you,” joked about an acquaintance stealing one-liners because he’s Jewish, and went by the name “n1ggerkiller” in an online game. “I’m very disappointed in my teenage son’s words, and I sincerely apologize for the insensitivity. This language is unacceptable, anywhere. Needless to say, I’ve already spoken with him about this, he has apologized, and I apologize as well,” Sen. Flake said in a statement to BuzzFeed. Although Tanner has since locked his Twitter account, a series of tweets from January and February show the Arizona Republican’s son repeatedly using the slurs. Additionally, Flake posted screenshots of scores from games on “Fun Run,” a social gaming app. The screenshots show that Flake goes by the name of “n1ggerkiller.” There is more at the link but I can paraphrase...he calls Mexicans "#$%$ of the Earth" and it appears that in the Flake household the words #$%$" and "Fa**ot" get used a lot. Let's help get this story in the news, DU. It seems like MSNBC is taking all their news from DU's Greatest Page lately. I think it is simply a case of the nut not falling far from the tree. The nut just hasn't been taught you can't say those things in public... just to your friends and the people buying your father's senate seat for him. "

Topic.Title: NEARLY HALF OF ALL AMERICANS SAY SURVEILLANCE ARE ACCEPTABLE WITHIN LIMITS

Message.Msg: crown, I appreciate your reply, but I also recommend you read the comments of General Alexander when he testified before congress. I have far more faith in our government, because I have not seen or heard of any illegal use of info it derives from many sources. However, communications entities, such as facebook, twitter, tweets, instand messages, etc. are already used to defame and smear not only private citizens, but also politicians. So far, it is my belief that the OB administration has done everything possible to keep our country safe.

Topic.Title: he gave up his job of 3 months to save my privacy and yours too, if you can figure out what privacy you had lost let me know

Message.Msg: That's why I don't bother trying to make my account anonymous. They have my connecting IP (unless I use a relay, and most relay IP's are known and sometimes screened) and that effectively give's them my address, so I don't even bother trying at all. On the other hand some people live in a way that could be damaging to their career or their life if their identity and/or location were to be discovered, so you can't argue there's NO privacy. For those people firewalls, anonymous relays, VPN's, and every other way of masking their traffic might be needed. Remember though, that no matter how paranoid you are, the system administrator can see everything that passes through his ports and if desired record every byte going in each direction. Do that often enough and even relays won't help unless you change relays often or use a chain of them.

Message.Title: Satanic verses
Message.Msg: HELL (The Borowitz Report)—Word that the News Corporation chief executive Rupert Murdoch has filed for divorce from his wife, Wendi Deng, came as a “total surprise” to longtime Murdoch confidant Satan, the Lord of the Underworld said today. A frequent dining companion of the Murdochs, Satan said he “didn’t have a clue that they were having problems.” “I’ve had dozens of dinners with them in the Hamptons,” he said. “Did they bicker? No more than other couples. But they seemed to be on the same page about all the important things, like creating corrupt media monopolies and buying politicians. I thought they were for keeps.”
